intro: Palala macrocarpa, commonly known as the giant kānuka, is a distinctive plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its large, spreading form and rough, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are followed by woody, cone-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Palala macrocarpa is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for native wildlife.
